review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2025
review-text: Phone came and looked really nice, everything seem to work but my data. My phone company was able to to turn it on manually, then out of nowhere it stops working again, this time my company is not able to get my data to work. Text and calls work but thats about it unless I have wifi. Probably not a legitimate company refurbishing the phones. When I received my phone I also noticed it did not even feel the same in weight as my old one, so probably cheaper materials.

span: Advertised as Excellent - had a defect
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
review-text: This was advertised as in excellent condition; but when I got it and started to transfer my data over, the USB C did not work for data. It did work for charging. So, I had to find other ways to transfer my data such as NFC, etc. But, when I was done after spending four hours of my time to get everything set up, the device did not work in my car for navigation; again, because the USB C did not work for data. It was a pain to try and set up, going back and forth researching for solutions on YouTube, etc. And then, it was working one moment and not the other. So, I gave up. Went back to my old phone which worked fine but the screen colors had dimmed a bit.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2025
review-text: It's a nice phone, but the one I got, the volume button is completley dead despite getting a "renewed" phone. Can't get a new one without my data disapearing nor could I get a refund.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2024
review-text: Was really excited to get a new 10 after mine stopped taking a charge. A few things I noticed with my new 10, it didn't like my SD card, so most of my photo memories are gone. Especially of my mom who just recently passed. My S-pen is damaged, both the pen itself and the indicator when I plug my phone in to charge. I constantly have to fight with the brightness level a few times a day. Any email, private message gets to me a few days late. This was not a problem with my previous 10, so I'm a bit annoyed. Now to make this phone work til I can get a new one that isn't broken from day 1.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2024
review-text: Recd earlier than expected which was great. But setting it up and the pen does not work. Let see what the dealer says as I contacted them.  Hopefully they can resolve as I transferred everything already

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2022
review-text: The phone overall was good, looked new even. The battery life wasn't the best and it did heat up but the main problem and reason why I won't be using Amazon renewed again is because who would've guessed, the phone is locked. At first, I didn't mind all too much and figured I could simply unlock it with the resources given, nope. I've called customer support 3 times, went to a store, basically just wasted a lot of time to finally be told it can't be unlocked. Disappointed but as long as I get my refund and rid of this mess, then whatever.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2022
review-text: When I see refurbished, I see a product that will pass by Company standards as almost new because of the testing it goes through. Had I known I was purchasing a phone that was very well loved so much that Tik Tok is burnt into the screen, I would have flat out put the 1500 down on a brand new Note model. This is ridiculous,  but considering I'm close to an upgrade, I'll just deal with what I have for another month. It was a rip off considering the condition of the screen burned images, otherwise everything else works fine.

span: No wireless charging and crunching noise when pressing on screen
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2025
review-text: Wireless charging does not work and makes a concerning crunching noise when pressing down on the screen just above the fingerprint sensor.

span: Not refurbished with OEM glass, poor customer support.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022
review-text: Had the phone 2 days. Was in my pocket at my desk job and glass broke. I suspect they are refurbished with less then satisfactory glass, because OEM glass for this phone it a 300 dollar expense. they accepted return and denied once received leaving me in an awkward position and using auto reply support that sends one message a day. Would not purchase from them again and wouldn't purchase this phone again because of the horrendous glass replacement cost.
